page.title: 13Woodlands Garden Centre
page.content: This ten acre field has been turned into a{garden centre}in the past year, propogating shrubs, heathers, conifers and ornamental trees by cuttings and grafts, and selling mainly to the {garden nursery trade. Water is pumped from a{bore hole}on the land and into a reservoir. Soil is delivered in lorry loads of 10 cubic metres, and the plants are grown in pots on{constantly watered sand}in {polynet 'tunnels'.}These tunnels consist of plastic sheeting on curved supports, large enough for men and machinery to work inside. The sheeting sides can be rolled up to allow air to filter through plastic netting, giving the interior the coolness and humidity of a cathedral even on the hottest day. There are three of the tunnels at present and the area has to be protected by rabbit and deer netting.
